Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky dark brown below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1415) (phase 2)
